phasesStructure.focus: Core concepts every backend engineer needs
Deep dives based on target company/role
Get ready for interviews at your target company

interviewPrep.title: Interview Preparation
interviewPrep.description: What to expect and how to prepare

prepTips: Check technical setup (good internet, quiet space)
Time yourself - aim for sub-40 mins
Write clean, readable code with comments
Master the framework: Requirements â†’ Architecture â†’ Deep Dives
Discuss trade-offs (consistency vs availability, latency vs throughput)
Be prepared to scale to 1M+ users
Use STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Prepare stories about: conflict resolution, failure, success, learning
Quantify impact where possible (30% improvement, shipped feature)
Ask genuine questions about team and culture
Show genuine interest in the company

interviewPrep.overallStrategy: System design is now mandatory even for mid-level roles. Companies want engineers who think about monitoring, logging, and tracing from the start. Focus on distributed systems expertise and security-first mindset.
successFactors: Flawless code implementation with error handling
Think out loud - explain your approach

recommendedProjects.title: Build Real-World Projects
recommendedProjects.description: Projects that showcase your backend skills to recruiters

projects.name: REST API with Express
projects.description: Build a full CRUD API with authentication and database
projects.whyValuable: Shows you understand HTTP fundamentals, RESTful principles, and can build a working API
projects.githubTip: Add comprehensive README with API docs, setup instructions, and example requests

projects.name: Todo App Backend
projects.description: Simple but complete backend for todo management with user accounts
projects.whyValuable: Full-stack thinking: understand how frontend consumes your API
projects.githubTip: Deploy to Heroku/Railway so recruiters can test it live

projects.name: Blog Platform API
projects.description: REST API for a blogging platform with posts, comments, tags
projects.whyValuable: Shows understanding of relationships, filtering, pagination
projects.githubTip: Include Postman collection for easy API testing

projects.name: Scalable Chat API
projects.description: Real-time chat system with WebSockets, message persistence, and scaling considerations
projects.whyValuable: Demonstrates understanding of real-time systems and scalability
projects.githubTip: Deploy to production and document how you handle 1000+ concurrent users

projects.name: High-Traffic Rate Limiter
projects.description: Implement a distributed rate limiter that works across multiple servers
projects.whyValuable: Shows understanding of distributed systems and operational concerns
projects.githubTip: Include benchmarks showing throughput and latency metrics

projects.name: E-commerce Order Service
projects.description: Microservice for handling orders with inventory management and payment integration
projects.whyValuable: Real-world complexity: transactions, third-party APIs, error handling
projects.githubTip: Show how you handle payment failures and maintain consistency

projects.name: Distributed Cache Layer
projects.description: Build a custom distributed caching system with consistency guarantees
projects.whyValuable: Shows deep understanding of caching, consistency, and distributed algorithms
projects.githubTip: Include research paper references and performance comparisons to Redis

projects.name: Event-Driven Notification System
projects.description: Complex system handling notifications across multiple channels with retries and failure handling
projects.whyValuable: Real production concerns: reliability, observability, failure modes
projects.githubTip: Show how you monitor and alert on failures, include chaos engineering tests

projects.name: GraphQL Federation Gateway
projects.description: Build a federation gateway for composing multiple GraphQL services
projects.whyValuable: Advanced API design: composition, schema stitching, real-world microservices pattern
projects.githubTip: Benchmark query performance and document federation patterns

tabs.name: Scaled Startups

successIndicators.title: How to Know You're Ready
successIndicators.description: Key milestones before applying to your target role

indicators.indicator: Can design systems that handle 1M+ requests/day
Can discuss trade-offs in system design
